Label: Source ID
Commentary: RECNO from FDT; ID from GoU Devt/Donor Devt

Label: Source Table
Commentary: Name of original table

Label: Spender
Description: Name of the spending source. Either the Government of Uganda, or the specific donor who provided the funds. If the specific donor is not known, then "Donors" is provided.

Label: Spender
Description: The ID for the spending source. This is 001 for the Government of Uganda (to follow the Government of Uganda Chart of Accounts code), the Uganda COA code for donors (where the donor is known), and 901 for donors (where the donor is unknown).

Label: Spending Source Type
Description: The type of spending source (1=GoU; 2=Aid; 3=Budget Support)

Label: Spending Source Type
Description: The name of the type of spending source (Government of Uganda, "Aid" for project aid, and Budget Support)

Label: Aid Programme Code
Commentary: From AGMTCODE (FDT)

Label: Aid Programme Name
Commentary: From Programme-AGMTTITLE

Label: COA Code of Donor
Description: Uganda Chart of Accounts code for donor
Commentary: Already included in from.id though Uganda Chart of Account Donor Code (FDT data only)

Label: Donor Name
Commentary: Already included in from.label... Name of donor (FDT)

Label: Donor project  number
Commentary: Donor's project reference no (FDT)

Label: MTEF Sector
Commentary: Medium-Term Expenditure Framework Sector

Label: MTEF Reference
Commentary: Medium-Term Expenditure Framework Reference (Except FDT)

Label: Sector Strategy or Policy
Commentary: (FDT only)

Original Field: Details of sector policy or strategy
Label: Sector Strategy or Policy Details
Commentary: (FDT only)

Label: Aid Modality
Commentary: Project or Budget Support (FDT only)

Label: Project Type
Commentary: Type of Project (FDT only)

Label: Grant or Loan
Commentary: Grant or Loan (FDT only)

Label: On or Off Budget
Commentary: On/off budget (FDT only)
EXCLUDE: Poverty Alleviation Framework (hardly exists anywhere)

Label: Sector Working Group
Commentary: Sector Working Group (COFOG-ish classification)

Label: Sector Objective
Commentary: Sector Objective nests perfectly under SWG

Label: PEAP Pillar
Commentary: Poverty Eradication Action Plan (classification is now deprecated)

Label: PEAP Objective
Commentary: Poverty Eradication Action Plan (classification is now deprecated)

Label: PEAP Area
Commentary: Poverty Eradication Action Plan (classification is now deprecated)
EXCLUDE: DP and GOU identified if the project is Donor or GOU funded or both, but this has not been updated for FDT data and looking at amounts (Outturn) is therefore much more accurate
EXCLUDE: DP and GOU identified if the project is Donor or GOU funded or both, but this has not been updated for FDT data and looking at amounts (Outturn) is therefore much more accurate

Label: Amount
Description: Amount committed or disbursed in this year in Ugandan Shillings.
Commentary: Calculated for FDT data using the following conversion rates (based on Donor Development ratios for each year): 2003/4: 1 USD = 1.847 UGX; 2004/5: 1 USD = 1.804 UGX; 2005/6: 1 USD = 1.779 UGX

Label: Dollar Amount
Description: Amount committed or disbursed in this year in US Dollars
Commentary: Amount committed or planned in this year in US Dollars

Label: Donor Amount
Description: Amount committed or disbursed in this year in the donor currency (if available)
Commentary: Amount committed or planned in this year in the donor currency. Not calculated for all data.

Label: Spending Type
Description: Whether the spending is a commitment (planned) or a disbursement (outturn)

Label: Donor's currency
Description: Currency in which Donor Amount was provided in (if any)
Commentary: Donor's currency
EXCLUDE: all the data has been normalised.... Order of magnitude of donor's currency. Multiply Outturn_Donor by this to get the actual amount in the donor's currency.

Label: Financial year
Commentary: The financial year that this money was disbursed or planned for

Label: Financial comments
Description: A 1 denotes that this entry is a value created to offset budget support from Government of Uganda spending. This is necessary to avoid double-counting when showing aggregations (of Government of Uganda spending, budget support and project aid) at higher levels, but it does not affect the actual amounts in the projects. Budget Support is money given directly to the government which they can spend on their own priorities. General Budget Support is given directly to the Treasury or Finance Ministry, and Sector Budget Support is given to an individual sector. Because of the nature of budget support, it is impossible to accurately track it through the system down to an individual project level. Below the higher levels, budget support thus becomes part of Government of Uganda revenues.
